intro: Xanthocephalum wrightii, commonly known as Wright's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming in spring and summer. Xanthocephalum wrightii is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
